comment.text: Runs since it was ready in koji and looks ok for me. Works on baremetal (non UEFI mode) AMD Ryzen5 3600, Mainboard MSI B450M Mortar Max with prop. nvidia driver (510.47.03) from rpmfusion.org (GTX980 card). Works with Gnome-Desktop (Xorg). Regression test passed.
Works on NUC7i

Both regression tests passed. 

Hardware: 3700X w/ RTX 2060

Issues I found though were neither Minecraft nor Counter Strike games will launch now. Not sure why.
works fine for me on two boxes (1 baremetal, 1 VM)
Default & performance tests pass (KVM)
It works ok on X1 Carbon9 i7-1165G7

Fine in normal use on laptop. Default and Performance kernel regression tests PASS on:

  • NUC6i5SYK, Intel® Core™ i5-6260U CPU @ 1.80GHz × 4, Mesa Intel® Iris(R) Graphics 540 (SKL GT3)
  • Dell XPS 13 9350, Intel® Core™ i7-6560U CPU @ 2.20GHz × 4, Mesa Intel® Iris(R) Graphics 540 (SKL GT3)
PASS
Default & performance tests pass (KVM)

Working OK here.

ASUS G750JS 1 x Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4700HQ CPU @ 2.40GHz

Intel Corporation 4th Gen Core Processor Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 06)
NVIDIA Corporation GK104M [GeForce GTX 870M] (rev a1)

Fedora 35

Works for me...  
The regression tests pass OK. AMD 965, x86_64 work station (legacy BIOS). SSD's > RAID1. Plasma DE from Zawertun's COPR. Running Xorg, nVidia GT1030 card using nVidia RPM's from RPMFusion (510.47.03)
i7-9700K(UHD Graphics 630): kernel regression test passed. Works fine for daily use.
Works on Acer Aspire Intel® Core™ i7-3632QM CPU @ 2.20GHz Memory: 15.4 GiB of RAM Graphics Processor: Mesa DRI Intel® HD Graphics 4000. Passed all kernel regression tests.

bugs.title: CVE-2022-0435 kernel: remote stack overflow via kernel panic on systems using TIPC may lead to DoS

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-0435 kernel: remote stack overflow via kernel panic on systems using TIPC may lead to DoS

long_desc.thetext:
A  remote stack overflow in the TIPC networking module. With FORTIFY_SOURCE's stricter memcpy() bounds checking, this can be exploited to cause remote DOS via kernel panic on systems using TIPC. Prior to these bounds checks, and with a canary leak (or no CONFIG_STACKPROTECTOR), this can be exploited for RCE.

Reference:
https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/02/10/1

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2053129]

Created oVirt tracking bug for this issue:

Affects: oVirt Node 4.4 [ bug #2056597 ]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.4 Extended Update Support

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.4 Extended Update Support

  Red Hat Virtualization 4 for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2022:0841 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:0841

Via RHSA-2022:0849 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:0849

bugs.title: CVE-2022-0516 kernel: missing check in ioctl allows kernel memory read/write

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-0516 kernel: missing check in ioctl allows kernel memory read/write

long_desc.thetext: A vulnerability was found in kvm_s390_guest_sida_op in arch/s390/kvm/kvm-s390.c in KVM for s390 in the Linux kernel. In this flaw, a local attacker with a normal user privilege may impact in unauthorized memory write access.

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2053178]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.4 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2022:0777 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:0777

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2022:0825 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:0825

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-0516

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# Description of your update

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

title: kernel-5.16.9-100.fc34
